title: Little Rock Central High School National Historic Site: Little Rock Nine
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     History & Culture     People     Little Rock Nine                The Little Rock Nine      Nine African-American teenagers faced great obstacles and angry mobs in September 1957 to desegregate Little Rock Central High School. Ranging in ages from 15 to 17, these teenagers showed an enormous amount of courage and are considered civil rights activists - meaning that they fought for the right for children all over the country to attend the school of their choice regardless of their race.Today, history remembers these students as the “Little Rock Nine.” Their actions showed the world that individuals who act upon their beliefs can change the course of history.
